bibl.title: Paradigms and Paradoxes in the Hellenistic World.
bibl.note: I. From paradigms to paradoxes. - II. Seeing paradox. - III. Defining and dealing with paradox. - IV. Public and private. - V. Writing paradox into ancient history. - See in part. pp. 376-378: "Hellenistic Egypt [is] a land of paradoxes. This starts at the top, with the multiple identities [Greek and / or Egyptian] of the Ptolemaic dynasty."
